graph.topic: Knowledge from experience is more important than that from books

nodes.text: I consider knowledge from experience as the more important source
knowledge acquired from books is greatly accepted
It is apparent that books are often written by professors, experts, or authorities in a variety of fields
it is right to the bulk of people
knowledge from experience seems a little different from information contained in books
it is common in books that water boils at 100 Celcius degree
it is difficult to apply knowledge from books into practice
it is easy to put knowledge from experience in real life
it is acquired from what have happened to them
a student decides to learn about chemical reactions from books
This method is likely to be fast, simple, and even safe
there is an increased likelihood that he neither remembers the necessary information for a long time nor knows how to do an make an experiment
if he goes to the library and carries out the reactions, he is certain to have a thorough grasp of the phenomena seen
He is also able to use this information for the next times
knowledge from experience helps people more than knowledge from books does
knowledge from books is widely accepted
Experiencing a thing and drawing information from it is really interesting and helpful
the accuracy of knowledge is crucially important
the result is not always the same in reality
it also depends on the height, the purity of the water, and even the measuring tool
the practicability is one of the most essential factors of knowledge
information contained in books is usually put in criteria
many people can read and understand the content
